dependencies.name: adios2
dependencies.description:
The Adaptable Input Output System version 2, developed in the Exascale
Computing Program

dependencies.name: darshan-runtime
dependencies.description:
Darshan (runtime) is a scalable HPC I/O characterization tool designed
to capture an accurate picture of application I/O behavior, including
properties such as patterns of access within files, with minimum
overhead. DarshanRuntime package should be installed on systems where
you intend to instrument MPI applications.

dependencies.name: darshan-util
dependencies.description:
Darshan (util) is collection of tools for parsing and summarizing log
files produced by Darshan (runtime) instrumentation. This package is
typically installed on systems (front-end) where you intend to analyze
log files produced by Darshan (runtime).

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: parallel-netcdf
dependencies.description:
PnetCDF (Parallel netCDF) is a high-performance parallel I/O library for
accessing files in format compatibility with Unidata's NetCDF,
specifically the formats of CDF-1, 2, and 5.

dependencies.name: unifyfs
dependencies.description:
User level file system that enables applications to use node-local
storage as burst buffers for shared files. Supports scalable and
efficient aggregation of I/O bandwidth from burst buffers while having
the same life cycle as a batch-submitted job. UnifyFS is designed to
support common I/O workloads, including checkpoint/restart. While
primarily designed for N-N write/read, UnifyFS compliments its
functionality with the support for N-1 write/read.

dependencies.name: veloc
dependencies.description:
Very-Low Overhead Checkpointing System. VELOC is a multi-level
checkpoint-restart runtime for HPC supercomputing infrastructures

dependencies.name: ascent
dependencies.description:
Ascent is an open source many-core capable lightweight in situ
visualization and analysis infrastructure for multi-physics HPC
simulations.

dependencies.name: catalyst
dependencies.description:
Catalyst is an in situ use case library, with an adaptable application
programming interface (API), that orchestrates the alliance between
simulation and analysis and/or visualization tasks.

dependencies.name: py-cinema-lib
dependencies.description:
cinema_lib is a set of tools and library for interacting with a Cinema
database (currently Spec A and Spec D) through Python and the command
line tool, cinema.

dependencies.name: py-cinemasci
dependencies.description: A set of python tools for reading, writing and viewing Cinema databases

dependencies.name: paraview
dependencies.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application.

dependencies.name: visit
dependencies.description:
VisIt is an Open Source, interactive, scalable, visualization, animation
and analysis tool. See comments in VisIt's package.py for tips about
building VisIt with spack. Building VisIt with Spack is still
experimental and many standard features are likely disabled
LINUX-------------------------------------------------------------------
spack install visit ^python+shared ^glib@2.56.3 ^py-setuptools@44.1.0
LINUX-W/O-OPENGL--------------------------------------------------------
spack install visit ^python+shared ^glib@2.56.3 ^py-setuptools@44.1.0 \
^mesa+opengl
MACOS-------------------------------------------------------------------
spack install visit ^python+shared ^glib@2.56.3 ^py-setuptools@44.1.0 \
^qt~framework

dependencies.name: vtk-m
dependencies.description:
VTK-m is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for emerging
processor architectures. VTK-m supports the fine-grained concurrency for
data analysis and visualization algorithms required to drive extreme
scale computing by providing abstract models for data and execution that
can be applied to a variety of algorithms across many different
processor architectures.

dependencies.name: sz
dependencies.description: Error-bounded Lossy Compressor for HPC Data

dependencies.name: zfp
dependencies.description:
zfp is a compressed number format for multidimensional floating-point
and integer arrays. zfp provides compressed-array classes that support
high throughput read and write random access to individual array
elements. zfp also supports serial and parallel (OpenMP and CUDA)
compression of whole arrays.
